NAME: Samarth Gupta
ABOUT:
- Working on mobile application development from the past 2 years.
- Experience in Backend development in Node.js.
- Proficient in Data Structures and Algorithms.
- Publication titled 'Object Detection in Foggy Conditions by Fusion of Saliency Map and YOLO', presented in Twelfth International Conference on Sensing Technology at University of Limerick, Ireland.
- Hackathon Enthusiast
- Got selected in Hack.Bangalore organized by Mercedes Benz, Research and Development, as one of the top 10 teams across India, and worked on problem statement of increasing visibility in foggy conditions.
- Worked on a project related to BLEs (Bluetooth low energy beacons) for the Vistara Aviation hackathon which aimed to work on increasing the mobility of the visually disabled using this IOT technology.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
SHOTS was a commercial Android project taken up by Team Cryptix. 
The project's theme is Education. In this project our main aim was to promote systematic learning within a definite period of time, with the help of articles, videos and podcasts.
The user was allowed to create a profile and chose his/her interest and on the basis of that the content was provided to him/her. 
It helped him learn and explore various opportunities.
Through this project we aimed to reinvent the meaning of education.

Albus is the latest innovation which will transform the Bus Department and its whole redundant ticketing system. 
It is the most radical step to advancement of the bus transportations.
In times of the digitalisation and the society moving towards cashless economy, it is now the need of the hour.
1. First ever Dynamic QR Scanner AlBus App.
With just scanning the QR just while boarding the bus and the App will be automated to be able to provide the user with the digitalised ticket just by selecting the destination stops from the list of subsequent stops within couple of seconds.
2. Defaulters will have a hard time. 
Using the locations services we will be able to penalize the commuters who try to evade buying tickets of the required amount by informing the concerned authorities.
3. Target audience is wide.
Buses contribute to the 90% of public transport in India, this means our target audience is high. 
4. Maintain a personal profile of every user.
After authenticating user on the basis of IDs we will provide options to maintain a personal profile, recharge wallet by online payments, and shows past trips of the user.
5. Setting Automatic Alarm and Vibration
Using RealTime Location services, we have installed speech module that will act as a reminder in the form of alarm that will be able to alert the user when he is about to reach the destination. It gives the passenger a carefree ride.
6.Tickets
We will be able to give a digitalised ticket to the user and thus we are going green. User can take the screenshot of the ticket once the payment is done after fare calculation.
7. Albus-QR App
There will be a second app which will be installed permanently in the bus which will change its QR dynamically using the locations of the bus. When about to reach the destination, the QR will change.
8. Help
Helpline number, email ID and some of the basic questions are answered.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Object Detection in Foggy Conditions by Fusion of Saliency Map and YOLO
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Developed an algorithm for detecting objects under foggy conditions. Fusion of Saliency Map with the results of YOLO gave better results than general implementation of YOLO Algorithm on the image frame.
This research paper is soon to be published in the journal CCIS, Springer.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: ABLE - Airport Bluetooth Low Energy Application
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Developed Android application for Vistara Aviation Hackathon which aimed to help the visually impaired travellers navigate through the airport using the Bluetooth Beacon technology and providing them single click assistance. Tools used - Java, XML.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: CLASSVARE - Classroom Virtual & Augmented Reality Experience
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Mobile VR educational application which provided access to features like Virtual Laboratories and Virtual field trips. Developed the backend using Node.JS to get chemicals in the virtual chemistry lab dynamically. Tools used - Javascript.
